004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007/** NetworkTables Remote Procedure Call (Server Side). */
008@SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
009public final class RpcAnswer {
010  /** Entry handle. */
011  public final int entry;
012
013  /** Call handle. */
014  public int call;
015
016  /** Entry name. */
017  public final String name;
018
019  /** Call raw parameters. */
020  public final byte[] params;
021
022  /** Connection that called the RPC. */
023  public final ConnectionInfo conn;
024
025  /**
026   * Constructor. This should generally only be used internally to NetworkTables.
027   *
028   * @param inst Instance
029   * @param entry Entry handle
030   * @param call Call handle
031   * @param name Entry name
032   * @param params Call raw parameters
033   * @param conn Connection info
034   */
035  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ArrayIsStoredDirectly")
036  public RpcAnswer(
037      NetworkTableInstance inst,
038      int entry,
039      int call,
040      String name,
041      byte[] params,
042      ConnectionInfo conn) {
043    this.m_inst = inst;
044    this.entry = entry;
045    this.call = call;
046    this.name = name;
047    this.params = params;
048    this.conn = conn;
049  }
050
051  static final byte[] emptyResponse = new byte[] {};
052
053  /*
054   * Finishes an RPC answer by replying empty if the user did not respond.
055   * Called internally by the callback thread.
056   */
057  void finish() {
058    if (call != 0) {
059      NetworkTablesJNI.postRpcResponse(entry, call, emptyResponse);
060      call = 0;
061    }
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
066   *
067   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
068   */
069  public boolean isValid() {
070    return call != 0;
071  }
072
073  /**
074   * Post RPC response (return value) for a polled RPC.
075   *
076   * @param result result raw data that will be provided to remote caller
077   * @return true if the response was posted, otherwise false
078   */
079  public boolean postResponse(byte[] result) {
080    boolean ret = NetworkTablesJNI.postRpcResponse(entry, call, result);
081    call = 0;
082    return ret;
083  }
084
085  /* Network table instance. */
086  private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
087
088  /* Cached entry object. */
089  NetworkTableEntry m_entryObject;
090
091  /**
092   * Get the entry as an object.
093   *
094   * @return NetworkTableEntry for the RPC.
095   */
096  NetworkTableEntry getEntry() {
097    if (m_entryObject == null) {
098      m_entryObject = new NetworkTableEntry(m_inst, entry);
099    }
100    return m_entryObject;
101  }
102}
